org.mitre.provenance.plusobject

Class AbstractDirectedEdge

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.provenance.plusobject.AbstractDirectedEdge
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SourcedObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NonProvenanceEdge, PLUSEdge

    public abstract class AbstractDirectedEdge
extends Object
implements SourcedObject
    An abstract representation of a directed edge in a graph. These edges may be marked, to provide support for the surrogate algorithm. Each edge may have a from marking, and a to marking, corresponding to the from and to sides of the edge. By default, markings are always EdgeMarking.SHOW.

    Note that edge markings are not persisted in the database; typically they are computed for whomever is looking at the edge.

    The originating portion of the edge is also called "from", while the terminating portion is called "to". An edge that goes A -> B and is labeled "foo" would have from=A, to=B, type=foo.

    Author:
    dmallen

      • getSourceHints

        public SignPost getSourceHints()
        Description copied from interface: SourcedObject
        Get the source hints information about this object. This is typically not stored in a database, but is meta-provenance describing who stores the object, such as in the case of distributed objects.
        Specified by:
        getSourceHints in interface SourcedObject

      • getVerdict

        public EdgeMarking getVerdict()
        Verdict is the overall determination on the edge. So for example if either marking is "hide", this will return "hide". If either is "infer" it will return "infer". It will only return show if both nodes voted show, or if neither node voted.
        Returns:
        the verdict marking that should be used to decide whether to display an edge to users.
